verses.text: My son, attend unto my wisdom, \add And\add* bow thine ear to my understanding:
That \add thou\add* mayest regard discretion, And \add that\add* thy lips may keep knowledge.
For the lips of a strange \add woman\add* drop \add as\add* a honeycomb, And her mouth \add is\add* smoother than oil:
But her end is bitter as wormwood, Sharp as a twoedged sword.
Her feet go down \add to\add* death; Her steps take hold on hell.
Lest thou shouldest ponder the path of life, Her ways are moveable, \add that\add* thou canst not know \add them\add*.
Hear me now therefore, O ye children, And depart not from the words of my mouth.
Remove thy way far from her, And come not nigh the door of her house:
Lest thou give thine honour unto others, And thy years unto the cruel:
Lest strangers be filled \add with\add* thy wealth; And thy labours \add be\add* in the house of a stranger;
And thou mourn at the last, When thy flesh and thy body are consumed,
And say, How have I hated instruction, And my heart despised reproof;
And have not obeyed the voice of my teachers, Nor inclined mine ear to them that instructed me!
I was almost in all evil In the midst of the congregation and assembly.
Drink waters out of thine own cistern, And running waters out of thine own well.
Let thy fountains be dispersed abroad, \add And\add* rivers of waters in the streets.
Let them be only thine own, And not strangersâ€™ with thee.
Let thy fountain be blessed: And rejoice with the wife of thy youth.
\add Let her be as\add* the loving hind and pleasant roe; Let her breasts satisfy thee at all times; And be thou ravisht always with her love.
And why wilt thou, my son, be ravisht with a strange \add woman\add*, And embrace the bosom of a stranger?
For the ways of man \add are\add* before the eyes of the \sc Lord\sc*, And he pondereth all his goings.
His own iniquities shall take the wicked himself, And he shall be holden with the cords of his sins.
He shall die without instruction; And in the greatness of his folly he shall go astray.
